Possible Back-end Enhancement.title: Possible Back-end Enhancement
Possible Back-end Enhancement.src:
Database
========

Consider separating tags from wiki entries, rather than 
integrated as part of wiki entry objects. Tag objects should 
have its own module for enforcing business constraints, which 
are essential for effective tagging (partitioning) of wiki 
entries based on categories. Specifically, 

- There can only be one unique tag per application instance,
  determined by the tag name.
- Each tag can refer to at most one unique wiki entry 
  identified by their title text.
- Similarly, each wiki entry can be tagged at most once by 
  any given tag object.
- Control characters **must be stripped** from tag names.
- All consecutive white space characters in tag names **must**
  be collapsed into a single ASCII white space. However, single
  non-ASCII space characters are permitted to remain as they 
  are.

Wiki entries are not supposed to know which categories they 
belong to; They should only need to know when they're last 
edited, the date they're created, its title and its source code.

**Wiki entry objects** should also abide to the following rules:

- One unique wiki entry title per application.
- No control characters allowed in **Mime Type** and **Title**
  fields.
- In the same field, process white space in the same way as the 
  tag names do to its white space characters.



Database Indexing
=================

Currently, there are seven different kinds of indices in the 
wiki. The code necessary to generate the HTML DOM element and 
the underlying data structure is verbose, often repeated and 
tedious. This is due to the nature of HTML DOM, which are 
mostly sequential and linear, opposed to a wiki which 
provides random access.

If able, these indices should be isolated from the database 
object as an aggregate, which will be generated on the fly.


Database Object
===============

The database object itself is a bit too simple; It's simply a 
raw javascript object that used property names for different 
purposes, sometimes leaving the property values unused. The 
design flaw can be seen with edges (directed links) between 
wiki entries, where an integer value "1" is used as a property 
value that doesn't contribute anything.

The database object should be a more formally defined data 
structure, namely a Graph, with sufficient support for linking in 
reverse direction. Otherwise, finding all nodes that linked to a 
particular node can be an expensive O(n^^2^^) operation.



View Controller 
===============

The code base currently has severe problems with string literals 
repeatedly used in different areas. The worst offending use case 
are **jQuery CSS selectors**, which often have little to no variation 
from one another, but are used as string literals because of the 
CSS selector syntax:

"""
$("#someConstantModule").on("someEvent", ".js-wlink", ...)

function doSomething(evt)
{
 if ($(evt.target).hasClass("js-wlink"))
 {
  //Do something fancy.
 }
}
"""

Here, the class "js-wlink" refers to "javascript wiki links", 
which opens a wiki entry when they're clicked. Due to the nature 
of CSS selectors, the string value has to be repeated every time 
there's a different relationship regarding the link, such as 
whether it's a descendant of a particular kind of """div""". 
Instances of such string constants lead to difficult maintenance.



API & Architecture Design Flaws
===============================

1. In order to find forward links within a wiki entry, the engine 
   must perform the following procedure every time a wiki entry is 
   saved.

   1. Parse the text into HTML strings.
   2. Build the HTML DOM.
   3. Query the DOM for a list of links.

   The third step in the parsing process is critical for indexing 
   orphaned entries and their back links, which are very convenient 
   features to end-users. The other two steps are basic plain text 
   - HTML transformation. None of these steps can be combined or 
   simplified at the current state of affairs.

2. Rendering a wiki entry requires a database query to determine 
   whether to display links in a different way. (Red linking)

3. The rendering engine should not have to generate the same data 
   structure as ones used within the database. (Retrieving 
   edges from HTML DOM)

Possible Front-end Enhancement.title: Possible Front-end Enhancement
Possible Front-end Enhancement.src:
Editing Interface
=================

The **mime type** field of the editing interface should be a 
drop-down box offering a slew of choices with a default 
pre-selected. A simple text field may be too primitive an 
interface.

The **tags** field of the editing interface can use the same 
treatment; Either selecting a pre-existing tag or enter a 
new tag string manually.

The search & indexing result panel should have an explicit 
close button, rather than relying on an empty search query 
to close it.



Importing Interface
===================

The current interface for importing is limited to reading 
UTF-8 encoded text. It should be extended to accept other 
character sets in addition to UTF-8.

Enhancement Update.title: Enhancement Update
Enhancement Update.src:
March 22nd, 2014 Update
=======================

Regarding the issue with data store, I have decided to forfeit 
using a separate data store for tags; Tightly coupling keywords 
and tags with wiki entries is only natural, because these tags 
only have semantic meanings when they appear with these entries. 
I shall still enforce the business constraints required of tags 
and wiki entries.

I have created a """WikiNode""" utility class isolated from the 
database singleton, which has its own data validation scheme. 

I have also curated a new Directed Graph class object, which 
will be responsible as the formal data structure backing up the 
database. The introduction of the data structure should also 
reduce redundancy for generating data structures for indices. 
(Not yet finished)


New Problems Identified
-----------------------

- Lack of Error Reporting, both on the UI level and the API level
- Lack of Error detection and constraint enforcing at the API level

Enhancement Update 2.title: Enhancement Update 2
Enhancement Update 2.src:
March 23, 2014
==============

Identified a few key areas for engine improvement.

1. On initialization, instead of doing a nested loop to 
   find recently edited entries, sort the entries first,
   then pick the most recent few using a simple loop.



March 24nd, 2014 Update
=======================

Improvements
------------

- Consolidated similar, repeated littering string literals
  and CSS selectors so that it's easier to chase them down 
  for maintenance.

- Created factory modules for creating and managing Wiki entries,
  configuration objects, and hopefully, edge objects as well.



I have compiled a list of CSS selectors that are tightly coupled 
with javascript, and should not be changed at the CSS/HTML level:

; """.js-css-invis"""
: Toggles the visibility state of the HTML element.

; """.js-wlink"""
: Wiki-Links; Only applies to """<a>""" elements. Hyperlinks with 
  this class will exhibit special behaviors instead of the standard 
  hyperlink behavior, depending its container's CSS classes.

; """.js-content"""
: Content area label; Wiki-links under this container will open a 
  new wiki entry based on its URL.

; """.js-index"""
: Indexing area label; Wiki-links under this container will index 
  the database and post the result onto a specialized display.

; """.js-tags"""
: Tagging area label; Wiki-links under this container will index 
  and display all wiki entries that have this tag.

----

Meanwhile, here's a list of javascript events (Triggered via jQuery), 
and their descriptions.

; """EVT.INDEX"""
: Launches a popup modal box that displays a list of available 
  indexing methods. Clicking on one of these indexing methods 
  result in wiki entries being displayed arranged in a specific 
  order. Occurs on clicking the indexing button.

; """EVT.TAG"""
: Launches a popup modal box displaying the list of wiki entries 
  under a specific tag. Occurs when a tag hyperlink is clicked.

; """EVT.SAVE"""
: Serializes this entire application into one single HTML file, 
  where the location is to be specified by the user.

  Alternatively, saves a configuration object into the data store.

; """EVT.EXPORT"""
: Serializes the database into a JSON file for saving.

; """EVT.IMPORT"""
: Loads a plain text file into the database for viewing, or loads 
  a JSON file and merge that database into the current one, 
  overwriting any name conflicts.

; """EVT.LOAD"""
: Used by various static, hidden form elements for populating 
  the interface with data, and showing themselves.

; """EVT.CLOSE"""
: Closes or destroys the container window, such as an editing 
  form or a modal popup box. This is a generic event.



The following events are specific to the content area where 
wiki entries are displayed:

; """EVT.CLOSEO"""
: Closes all open wiki entries except the one that initiated
  this event.

; """EVT.EDIT"""
: Switches an open wiki entry into editing mode.

; """EVT.COMMIT"""
: Saves the wiki entry being edited into the database (memory).

; """EVT.CANCEL"""
: Discard changes and switch the wiki entry back to view mode.

; """EVT.DELETE"""
: Removes the wiki entry from storage.

; """EVT.OPEN"""
; Opens a wiki entry with a particular title for viewing.


New Problems Identified
-----------------------

- The popup modal box tag hyperlinks and indexing button does not 
  always appear right underneath the said elements under Firefox 27.

- When importing an external plain text file, the wiki engine always 
  treat the input as a data set regardless of the choices made in the 
  radio buttons.

- There's no way to specify the expected charset when importing a 
  file.



Closing
-------

Still pondering how to organize the database code so it's more human-
readable. Still wondering where to put the mime type registry, and 
still massively refactoring my code. Also forgot to finish my sentences.

================

Readied a bug fix where modal windows are spawning in unexpected
places. That is, when a tag link gets clicked, the modal box 
that contains all title links related to that tag fails to appear 
underneath the link.

Readied a bug fix for importing data sets; When the new configuration
